title: Instructional Design for Using Manipulatives in Mathematical Problem Solving

context.prior_knowledge: Basic mathematics concepts and foundational understanding of pedagogy
context.additional_context: Targeting pre-service teachers, this blended course (online lectures + offline practical sessions) aims to teach effective use of manipulatives in mathematical problem-solving and foster positive perceptions

learning_goals: Learners can explain three or more strategies for utilizing manipulatives in the mathematical problem-solving process
Learners can create a design plan for manipulative-based mathematics activities applicable to real classroom environments
Learners can demonstrate improved confidence and a positive attitude toward mathematics

resources: Diverse Math Manipulatives (Blocks, Geometric Shapes, Measurement Tools, etc.)

difficulty: Moderate - Standard complexity with some constraints
